meanings.definition: Resembling a drum in sound or rhythm.
meanings.sent1: The thunder was drumlike, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The drumlike beat of the music got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent3: The drumlike rain on the roof played a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent4: His heart pounded in a drumlike rhythm as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The drumlike sound of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Having the shape or appearance of a drum.
meanings.sent1: The round, drumlike table took up most of the room.
meanings.sent2: The drumlike tower stood tall against the skyline.
meanings.sent3: She carried a drumlike basket filled with goodies for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The drumlike clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The drumlike body of the car made it stand out on the road.
